page.title: 14CUSTOMS AND TRADITIONS
page.content: THERE ARE VARIOUS CUSTOMS WITHIN THE AREA, SOME CENTURIES OLD, OTHERS ONLY A FEW. MAYPOLE DANCING ON THE VILLAGE GREEN OF GREAT BENTLEY DATES BACK OVER 400 YEARS AND HAS RECENTLY BEEN REVIVED BY CHILDREN FROM THE LOCAL PRIMARY SCHOOL.A MAY-QUEEN IS CHOSEN AND THE CHILDREN PROCESS ACROSS THE GREEN LED BY 'JACK-O-THE-GREEN' AND THE HOBBY HORSE. VARIOUS TRADITIONAL DANCES ARE DANCED.'BEATING THE BOUNDS' IS A NOTHER ANCIENT CEREMONEY WHICH HAS RECENTLY BEEN REVIVIED. EVERY 7 YEARS A PARTY OF VILLAGERS WALK THE PARISH BOUNDARY TO 'MARK' IT FOR ALL TO SEE. BOYS ARE 'BEATEN' AT INTERVALS ALONG THE ROUTE TO REMIND THEM OF THE VILLAGE LIMITS. FOR THE LAST 9 YEARS THERE HAS BEEN AN EXTREMELY SUCCESSFUL AND COLOURFUL CARNIVAL. A FUN-FAIR VISITS THE GREEN EACH SEPTEMBER.
